text:
So I thought I’d start by telling you a bit about me,
I went to Uni in Farnham at the University for creative Arts and studied film production as I originally thought I wanted to work on set. After uni I managed to get a job at Universal in their TV networks department, this got me into post production and after a brief stint working at Red Bee in the post production facility for channel 4 I got a job at Framestore. I worked their for 3 years as a vfx coordinator before moving to Milk VFX and working my way up to VFX producer. At Milk I worked on films like Fantasic Beasts and where to find them and TV shows like Dr Who. My work as a producer meant I was involved in project from the very start, reading scripts and organising artists to do concepts or create previz and then following the project all the way through to final vfx delivery.

I understand you are interested in preproduction animation? Can you tell me a bit about why you think you are interested in that area and what you think the role would entail?

Hi Louise sorry for the late reply, I’m currently Newcastle at the moment so didn’t get a chance to look at my phone. :sweat_smile:

But wow that’s all so amazing! 
That’s really cool. 

I’m interested in either preproduction or actual animation (3D or 2d I’m not sure yet :sweat_smile:). I’m thought preproduction because for university project in second year I decided to do an 2d animated show around fake news. And when going through the process of making concepts and storylines and scripts. I personally found the story boarding and character design, coming up with narratives which is something I always done since childhood.

I thought animation as well as when selfteaching I enjoyed the process so much.

From the research I done I think preproduction entails a lot of self motivation and planning I know storyboarders look at scripts and work from them also produce animatics which are referenced by animators are sent to visual artist to develop further. I also know visual development artists exist but I’m a little confuse on the term tbh :sweat_smile:

Ah ok that makes more sense Dexter had told me you were interested in ‘pre production anim’. You generally work quite closely with a director when either storyboarding or coming up concept art. I think visual development artists is just another term for a concept artist. Some concept artists work free lance but companies like framestore also have a department for concept art <https://www.framestore.com/art-department>
Storyboard artists are usually freelance. This guy did a lot of the storyboards Of projects I worked on <http://www.freakhousegraphics.com>
If you are interested in pre production but also anim, Previz might be worth be looking into as that combines the two!
The third floor is a good example of a company that does that <http://thethirdfloorinc.com/film-tv/>
